text: Super Mario Bros. 35 was an online battle-royale style video game developed by Arika and published by Nintendo, in October 1, 2020. Its release was made for the Super Mario Bros. 35th Anniversary. It was made no longer playable after March 31, 2021; yet it still could be played into April 1, 2021. Then it was no longer played, but you could still run the software, and it would work until the software was closed. == Gameplay == The game is based off of Super Mario Bros., with every of its 32 levels. The player controls Mario (or Luigi, found in an easter egg) to fight 34 other players. Defeating an enemy would cause it to go on someone else's screen. Most of them are defeated by stepping on them. If a player is the last Mario alive, then they win. == References == Category:2020 video games Category:Battle royale games Category:Free-to-play video games Category:Mario platform games Category:Multiplayer online games Category:Nintendo Switch games Category:Nintendo Switch-only games Category:Video games developed in Japan
title: Super Mario Bros. 35
